issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
It appears that in a multi-cluster env, the request to stop the guest and/or create the snapshot can fail. The create-image task gets somewhat stuck in this state preventing retrying another  create-image task even if the original emi is de-registered. This looks similar to  EUCA-7523 but in this case I never saw a snapshot started for the create task?
Thanks,
-M


{code}
[root@e-07 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-B2874568
RESERVATION	r-3E5C4106	433405042008	test
INSTANCE	i-B2874568	emi-3B7F4128	10.111.101.103	1.115.34.156	running	test	0		m2.2xlarge	2013-09-12T04:45:36.288Z	PARTI01				monitoring-disabled	10.111.101.103	1.115.34.156			ebs					
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sda	vol-FE723F55	2013-09-12T04:45:36.526Z	true		
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sda	vol-FE723F55	2013-09-12T04:48:27.180Z	false		
TAG	instance	i-B2874568	euca:node	10.111.5.35



[root@e-07 ~]# euca-create-image i-B2874568 -n windowscreate -d windowscreate
IMAGE	emi-1F8F59CC

[root@e-07 ~]# euca-describe-images emi-1F8F59CC
IMAGE	emi-1F8F59CC	433405042008/windowscreate	433405042008	pending	private	x86_64	machine				ebs		BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	/dev/sdb

[root@e-07 ~]# euca-describe-snapshots SNAPSHOT	snap-D4CF4103	vol-42D73CBE	completed	2013-09-11T23:38:30.526Z	100%	433405042008	15	SNAPSHOT	snap-979B3B4F	vol-F9C53E70	completed	2013-09-06T01:44:18.003Z	100%	433405042008	2	Created by eutesterTAG	snapshot	snap-979B3B4F	block_dev_map_tests_build_image_snapshot

fields.summary: create-image task gets stuck in trying to stop vm. fails stuck in pending

comments.body:
10.111.1.112	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CLC WS UI]
10.111.1.119	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[CC00 SC00]
10.111.5.12	CENTOS	6.3	64	REPO	[NC00]

10.111.5.31	VMWARE	ESXI-5.0	64	REPO	[NC01]
10.111.5.35	VMWARE	ESXI-5.0	64	REPO	[NC01]

[~mclark] It is very likely due to the same problem as EUCA-7523 and EUCA-7558. Looks like the testing was done before the fix was committed. Can you test it again with the latest code? I'll mark the state "In QA".
